synopsis: This?standalone story?takes place in the same universe as The Walking Dead, but follows a new character named?Jeff?as he navigates the?zombie apocalypse?in Spain.

title: The Wicked + The Divine #1
author: Kieron Gillen
synopsis: The Wicked + The Divine follows the story of a group of people who are revealed to be?reincarnated gods?who live for two years before dying. The series explores themes of celebrity, fandom, and the nature of divinity.

synopsis: Tintin travels to the?United States?to investigate?organized crime?and corruption in Chicago and the Wild West.

title: Tintin in the Congo-1
author: Herge
synopsis: Tintin?travels to the?Belgian Congo?to report on the country's colonial administration, but soon becomes embroiled in a series of dangerous adventures.

title: Tintin in the Land of the Soviets #1
author: Herge
synopsis: Tintin, a young journalist, travels to?Soviet Russia?to report on the country's?communist regime, but he uncovers a sinister plot to sabotage his mission.

author: Herge

title: Transmetropolitan #1
author: Warren Ellis
synopsis: Transmetropolitan is set in a dystopian future where a journalist named?Spider Jerusalem?returns to the city after years of self-imposed isolation to expose the corruption and hypocrisy of the government and the media. The series explores themes of politics, media, and the nature of truth. Transmetropolitan has been praised for its biting satire, inventive world-building, and memorable characters.

title: Transmetropolitan #2
author: Warren Ellis
synopsis: In a dystopian future, a journalist named?Spider Jerusalem?returns to the city after years in isolation to report on the corrupt and depraved society that surrounds him.

title: Transmetropolitan #10
author: Warren Ellis
synopsis: Set in a dystopian future where politics and media have merged into one, journalist?Spider Jerusalem?returns to the city to report on the corruption and hypocrisy of those in power.

title: V for Vendetta #1
author: Alan Moore
synopsis: V for Vendetta?is set in a?dystopian future?where a?masked vigilante?named V seeks to overthrow the fascist government of the?United Kingdom. The series explores themes of totalitarianism, anarchy, and the power of ideas. V for?Vendetta?has been praised for its?political relevance, complex characters, and?iconic imagery.

title: Valerian and Laureline: Welcome to Alflolol-4
author: Pierre Christin
synopsis: Valerian and Laureline travel to the planet of Alflolol to investigate a strange epidemic that is affecting the local population.

author: Pierre Christin
synopsis: Valerian and Laureline journey to a planet where the inhabitants have lost their ability to dream, and must find a way to restore their creativity.

title: Watchmen #1
author: Alan Moore
synopsis: Watchmen?is set in an alternate version of the?United States?where superheroes are real and have been outlawed by the government. The story follows a group of?retired superheroes?as they investigate the murder of one of their own, and explores themes of power, corruption, and the consequences of vigilantism. Watchmen is considered to be one of the best?comic book series?ever written, and it has been adapted into a movie and a television series.

title: Watchmen #12
author: Alan Moore
synopsis: The epic conclusion to the groundbreaking?limited series, which explores the dark and complex world of superheroes and the consequences of their actions.

title: XIII: All the Tears of Hell-3
author: Jean Van Hamme
synopsis: XIII continues to search for his true identity, while being pursued by various organizations who want him dead or alive.

title: XIII: SPADS-4
author: Jean Van Hamme
synopsis: XIII joins a team of former?special forces soldiers?who are hired to take down a drug cartel in?South America.

title: Y: The Last Man #1
author: Brian K. Vaughan
synopsis: Y: The Last Man follows the story of?Yorick Brown, the last man on Earth after a mysterious event wipes out all?male mammals. The series follows his journey to discover the cause of the event and find a way to save humanity. The series explores themes of gender, identity, and the nature of humanity.

title: Y: The Last Man #2
author: Brian K. Vaughan
synopsis: Y: The Last Man is set in a world where a mysterious event has killed all?male mammals, except for one man named?Yorick?Brown and his?pet monkey. The series follows Yorick's journey to reunite with his girlfriend and discover the cause of the event. The series explores themes of gender, identity, and the nature of humanity.

title: Y: The Last Man #3
author: Brian K. Vaughan
synopsis: Y:?The Last?Man is set in a world where a mysterious event has killed every?male mammal?on Earth, except for one man, Yorick Brown, and his?pet monkey. The series follows?Yorick?as he tries to find a way to survive in this new world and unravel the mystery of what caused the event. The series explores themes of gender, identity, and the nature of humanity.

title: Y: The Last Man #4
author: Brian K. Vaughan
synopsis: After a catastrophic event kills all?male mammals?on Earth, a young man named?Yorick?and his?pet monkey?are the only survivors with a?Y chromosome, and they must navigate a world where women are in charge and desperate to find a way to save humanity.

title: Justice League of America: The Brave and the Bold
author: Gardner Fox
synopsis: Aquaman discovers Starro, an alien monster that can transform other creatures into duplicates of itself. He alerts the Justice League of America, and they divide to fight Starro and its spores. Green Lantern, Wonder Woman, Martian Manhunter, and The Flash each face one of Starro's spores. After defeating them, they join forces to stop the original Starro, using lime to incapacitate the monster. They make Snapper Carr an honorary member of the team for his unexpected help in defeating Starro.

title: X-Men: The Age of Apocalypse
author: Scott Lobdell
synopsis: The X-Men are warned that their mission could result in heavy casualties. Sunfire arrives, explaining that Apocalypse has resumed culling humans in Chicago with the help of Holocaust. Meanwhile, Gambit leaves to get the M'kraan Crystal, Nightcrawler goes on a mission to find Destiny, and Rogue and her team try to stop Holocaust's cullings in Chicago. Bishop believes the X-Men will fight to save their world, as the Professor would have wanted.
